description:
Please find my last try to shoot M101 with my 250mm Newton
A very famous galaxy with always the same framing ...
So after many versions of different framings and crops, I finaly get  this square framing with vertical rotation (north is left) which I like particularly : I think that we can see more the spreading arms and the small galaxies around  are placed to be remarked.
One little galaxy can be seen just above one arm at the top, and a galaxy group near NGC5471

It takes me 4 nights to complete the subs :  15/16, 26/27, 27/28 of february and 03/03 of march

Light 103 subs@180s 
Red 30subs@180s 
Blue 30subs@180s 
Green 30subs@180s 
Halpha 21subs@300s

I spent a lot of time with pixinsight to get the best possible with the subs  I had.
I wanted to get more Halpha subs but the weather is turning bad , so I decided to have a try anyway.

This time I also was more gentle with the saturation slider  :-) to get a more natural feeling and colors of the galaxy .  A specific process was done to reduce the star halos and to keep the color as well...

Tell me what you think
title: Pinwheel Galaxy and friends - M101 - HaLRGB
